label: BB001_01
name: Problem formulation
description: Enter a description of the problem formulation, which is is aimed at defining the purpose and scope of a risk assessment and the depth of the analysis. Please include the relevant regulation(s) that must be considered if an assessment is required for regulatory purposes. Also include the envisaged exposure scenario(s), the substance definition, etc. Give an indication on the level/uncertainty limits of the desired information. If possible: specify the areas of toxicity (knowledge gap to be filled), the level of need for mechanistic understanding and potential exit points (sufficient information reached)
method_link:
- National Research Council. 2009. Science and Decisions: Advancing Risk Assessment. https://nap.nationalacademies.org/read/12209/chapter/1
- US EPA. 2014. Framework for human health risk assessment to inform decision making. https://www.epa.gov/sites/def

label: BB002_01
name: Relevant existing data for substance of interest?
description: Search for available physicochemical, toxicological, mechanistic and toxicokinetic data about this compound in existing data sources. Compile all available data on exposure levels. Provide a transparent information overview, based on these data.

label: DP01EF_01
name: Information sufficient?
description: Justify if existing data is sufficient for answering the question posed in the Problem Formulation. If information is considered sufficient (Yes), record the basis for this decision and continue to BB003. If information is considered insufficient, specify the knowledge gaps or remaining uncertainties and continue to DP02EF.

label: BB003_01
name: Derive Point-of-Departure POD
description: Compile all data from assays considered to be predictive of hazard. For each assay, determine concentration dependency of the effect, fit a function through the data points and determine the minimum concentration, at which hazard may be triggered (equal BMC or BMCL). Give a rationale why and how this BMC has been chosen. Compile all BMCs and determine which of them is considered most relevant. This one is termed PoD. Give a rationale for the choice and indicate the uncertainty of the decision. Decide (and justify) whether a single PoD is chosen or whether multiple PoD are chosen. In the latter case decide and justify whether the multiple PoD are collapsed to a a single value (plus minus variance) is chosen, or whether work is continued with a distribution function of PoD

label: DP02EF_01
name: Is read-across applicable?
description: Consider read-across as alternative approach for addressing the regulatory question(s) at hand. Justify if the application of read-across can answer the question posed in the Problem Formulation.  The ECHA RAAF provides a framework against which such a justification can be structured

label: WF01_01
name: Perform dedicated workflow for NAM-based read-across
description: Perform the read-across assessment, using appropriate substances as source.

label: DP03EF_01
name: Information sufficient?
description: Does the read-across assessment provide sufficient information to address the regulatory question(s) with a sufficient level of certainty?

label: BB040_01
name: Identify data gap and testing strategy based on problem formulation
description: Consider whether the regulatory question(s) at hand can be addressed using NAMs. If so, outline necessary steps for hazard, ADME and exposure, where appropriate.

label: DP04EF_01
name: Is NAM -based testing feasible for the substance of interest?
description: Evaluate if the substance of interest has physico-chemical properties, which would interfere with its testing in the proposed NAMs methods coming from BB040

label: DP03EF_01
name: Are ADME properties known?
description: Search for existing ADME data and properties (in vitro to in vivo). Which PBK model is appropriate? Is anything alerting for properties not covered by the httk model, then continue to Include information about the uptake (route specific)/fraction unbound in plasma, metabolism (like clearance in liver), blood to plasma ratio. Search of existing information.

label: BB004_01
name: Generate basic set of in silico, in vitro kinetic data
description:
The type of data is dependent on the route of administration. A tiered approach is followed using in silico predictions and complementing them with in vitro data as far as needed. For oral route this as follows.
Tier 0 - in silico based 
This include info

label: BB005_01
name: Run ht-PBK model
description: Decide on PBK model structure. In case that no information is available to guide the decision use an existing high throughput PBK model like Tkplate, Minimal PBK model in Simcyp, htt etc..

label: DP07EF_01
name: Prediction of PBK model acceptable?
description: Continue with IVIVE. If not acceptable, then continue to BB006_01

label: BB006_01
name: Generate NAM data on additional ADME parameters
description: Improve PBK model using more accurate in vitro ADME data e.g. to cover active transport/enzyme induction/inhibition/low clearance compounds. Alternatively improve PBK model by integrating other relevant ADME processes into the model structure like enteroh

label: BB008_01
name: Derive estimates of relevant test concentrations
description: Derive estimates of relevant test concentrations using available information on ADME properties. Use the result for hazard testing.

label: BB009_01
name: Refine estimates of relevant test concentrations

label: DP05EF_01
name: Compound mainly cleared by metabolism?
description: An assessment of the major clearance mechanism of the compound (metabolism vs renal vs biliary excretion unchanged. Document the (1) criteria that have been considered for the decision; (2) data that have been used; (3) effect thresholds considered relevant; (4) thresholds of certainty required for data used; (5) discussion points and possibly consistency checks that have been important for the decision. With evolution of NAMASTOX, increasing levels of guidance on above points will be incorporated in this decision point.

label: BB025_01
name: Calculate appropriate hEC
description: reminder put it in twice,  after HT-PBK and mechanistic PBK assessment

label: BB043_01
name: Translate hEC into external human dose

label: WF02_01
name: Perform dedicated workflow for metabolites
description: Assess relevance of metabolite formation using the dedicated workflow

label: BB020_01
name: Map the uses of the substance
description: Describe the possible uses of the substances across different pathways (consumer, diet, occupational, environmental), including a description of available data.

label: BB021_01
name: Screen possible exposure scenarios
description: Screening possible exposure scenarios involves systematically identifying and evaluating situations where individuals or the environment might come into contact with a substance on factors sources/pathways, volume distribution, target population (workers,

label: BB040_01
name: Prioritize routes of exposure
description: Prioritize exposure routes (inhalation, dermal, oral) based on basic set of ADME properties (BB0004). Utilize ADME properties to evaluate the efficiency of absorption for each route and determine which exposure routes are most significant.

label: BB022_01
name: Estimate highest exposure for relevant routes and sources
description: Calculate for each population the highest exposure (worst-case) for relevant source(s) and route(s) using the collected data and absorption efficiency. Considering factors such as frequency and duration. Outcome is the input for high-content in vitro data

label: BB041_01
name: Prioritize sources of exposure
description:
Rank the sources of exposure based on realistic scenario descriptions, such as consumer use patterns or occupational scenarios.
Identify most relevant sources for aggregated exposure

label: DP14EF_01
name: Prediction of exposure estimate acceptable and sufficient quality?
description: (Qualitative) Description of the uncertainties of the current exposure assessment, including uncertainty induced by the exposure model used as well as by the input data.

label: BB023_01
name: Refinement of aggregate exposure. Deterministic
description: Refinement of the exposure estimate depending on the problem formulation. Iterative process which involves incorporation of new data, improving models and reducing uncertainties. This may involve additional data collection to improve the understanding of

label: BB024_01
name: Refinement of aggregate exposure. Deterministic or probabilistic
description: Refinement of the estimate depending on the problem formulation, such as realistic scenarios for the population of interest and refined timing of exposure. Refine the exposure assessment using NAM data on additional ADME parameters such as bioaccumulation

label: DP18EF_01
name: Prediction of exposure estimate acceptable?
description: An exposure assessment is considered sufficient when it comprehensively and accurately describes the conditions under which aggregate exposure to a substance occurs. This includes detailed information on the sources, pathways, routes, frequency, duration,

label: BB029_01
name: Consider other relevant types of testing or exposure measurements
description: Consider exposure measurements (external or internal), or other ADME testing. ML: here the purpose of doing other things shold be given. Ideally give a definition how you define that this OTHER method has provided the desired information

label: BB010_01
name: Generate toxicologically-relevant in silico predictions
description: (1) Use QSAR models (and other available computational methods) for predictions of relevant bioactivity (e.g. toxicological targets), of toxicological endpoints (e.g. genotoxicity) or of events that may be associated to AOP (MIE, KE, AO). (2) Document the

label: BB011_02
name: Identify bioactivity
description:
(1) Use an assembly of assays with a broad biological coverage. Ideally, all potential bioactivities that may lead to adverse reactions should be captured.
(2) The concentration range of the assays should be chosen and account for the potential exposure s

label: DP09EF_01
name: Is there a reason to enter a module for testing of specific toxicological endpoints outside core ASPA focus?
description: Check whether there is information (relevant and significant) that indicates a potential of the test chemical to trigger certain specific toxicological endpoints that are not at the core of the ASPA workflow (e.g. skin sensitization, genotoxicity, topical

label: WF03_01
name: Module for specific endpoints like acute topical toxicity or genotoxicity
description: Perform relevant Defined Approaches based and/or dedicated tests to confirm or characterize alert(s)

label: BB012_01
name: In vitro biokinetics
description: Determine distribution of test item within cell culture dishes used e.g. in BB011. The main focus shold be on the method  that is chosen for the most relevant PoD, but data may be generated for several methods. Data generation should be default use the Ce

label: BB013_01
name: Integration of initial hazard and bioactivity data
description:
Integrate the in silico and in vitro predictions (BB010-012).
Analyze and integrate the results obtained in previous steps

label: BB014_01
name: Derive Point-of-Departure estimates
description: Derive estimates of Point-of-Departure (POD).

label: DP10EF_01
name: Refinement of POD needed, given problem formulation?
description: Consider whether the confidence in the POD estimates is sufficient for the problem formulation at hand. Determine if the data obtained and generated combined provides sufficient scientific justification to support a clear Mode of action and whether this i

label: DP11EF_01
name: Specific toxicological alerts identified? AOPs triggered?
description: Are any specific toxicological alerts identified? Are any alerts for perturbation of AOPs identified? If so, at what dose? Is this dose meaningful?

label: BB015_01
name: Generate medium-throughput in vitro toxicity data e.g., for relevant qAOPs or Defined Approaches
description: This is a box that stands for a complex subroutine. The choice of NAM and the type of subroutine depends on the problem formulaton and the data generated in more upstream parts. For some narrowly defined problem formulations, more defined subroutines can

label: BB018_01
name: Generate medium-throughput in vitro toxicity data
description: Not clear what BB015 and BB018 exactly mean

label: BB016_01
name: In vitro biokinetics
description: Not clear what is the difference between BB012 and BB016

label: BB017_01
name: Integration of results
description: Integrate the results from more complex in vitro tests (BB015 and BB016).

label: DP12EF_01
name: PoD sufficiently refined? Confidence in PoD increased?
description: Did the results obtained from more complex in vitro tests result in sufficient refinement of the POD and its associated level of uncertainty?

label: BB019_01
name: Explore other types of NAMs to reduce uncertainty and refine POD
description: This needs more specification with time. It is defined e.g. as hit follow-up strategy or as part of the description of high-quality AOP (they also specify the respective NAM (and alternative NAM) to assess KE). Some of the information required needs to be

label: BB026_01
name: Compare hazard and exposure reference values
description: Also feedback loop missing if "no".  Consider aspects for improvement and reenter into ASPA workflow

label: REPORT_01
name: Report
description: Exit the ASPA workflow. Where applicable, integrate results with other assessments.

label: REPORT_02
name: Report
description: Exit the ASPA workflow. Where applicable, integrate results with other assessments.

label: REPORT_03
name: Report
description: Exit the ASPA workflow. Where applicable, integrate results with other assessments.

label: REPORT_04
name: Report
description: Exit the ASPA workflow. Where applicable, integrate results with other assessments.

label: REPORT_05
name: Report
description: Exit the ASPA workflow. Where applicable, integrate results with other assessments.

label: REPORT_06
name: Report
description: Consider aspect for improvement and reenter into ASPA workflow
